posts.post_content: As soon as this was spoiled, I made a proxy deck with [Clone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Clone), [Stolen Identity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stolen Identity), etc. I discovered that adding another creature that likes to be copied, such as [Timberpack Wolf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Timberpack Wolf), gives the deck another win condition and makes it more consistent.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Ultimate Biovisionary Deck (slight modification of the Ultimate [Storm Crow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Storm Crow) Deck   
  
18 Creatures  
4 [Biovisionary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Biovisionary)  
4 [Clone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Clone)  
4 [Phyrexian Metamorph](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Metamorph)  
4 [Sakashima's Student](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sakashima's Student)  
2 [Quicksilver Gargantuan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Quicksilver Gargantuan)  
  
18 Other Spells  
4 [Rite of Replication](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rite of Replication)  
4 [Cackling Counterpart](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cackling Counterpart)  
4 [Followed Footsteps](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Followed Footsteps)  
4 [Back From The Brink](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Back From The Brink)  
1 [Door of Destinies](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Door of Destinies)  
1 [Simic Signet](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Simic Signet)  
  
24 Lands  
4 [Evolving Wilds](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Evolving Wilds)  
10 [Island](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Island)  
4 [Forest](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Forest)  
4 [Halimar Depths](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Halimar Depths)  
2 [Cavern of Souls](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cavern of Souls)
posts.html:
Ultimate Biovisionary Deck (slight modification of the Ultimate Storm Crow Deck

18 Creatures

2 Quicksilver Gargantuan

18 Other Spells

4 Followed Footsteps
4 Back From The Brink

1 Simic Signet

24 Lands

10 Island
4 Forest
4 Halimar Depths
2 Cavern of Souls
